translation.en: [newswoman] A hotel with a notorious past is the site of another bizarre case.
translation.ko: 악명 높은 과거가 있는 호텔에서 또 기이한 사건이 일어났습니다

translation.en: It's one of the most obsessively followed true crime cases of the century.
translation.ko: 바로 금세기 가장 이목을 끈 범죄 중 하나인데요

translation.en: [newswoman 2] This gruesome discovery is the latest chapter
translation.ko: 이 끔찍한 사건은 세실 호텔의 어두운 역사에

translation.en: in a dark history for the Cecil Hotel.
[man] The Cecil?
You want to know about the Cecil.
translation.ko: 난 세실에 대해선 아는 게 없어요

translation.en: Wow.
Where should I start?
[man 2] The Cecil was a very deceiving hotel.
translation.ko: "세실 호텔 주중 객실 할인 - 객실 수 700개" 세실은 기만적인 호텔이었어요

translation.en: There's a lot of beauty to it.
But it was the complete opposite of beauty.
[man 3] A lot of people can't help but wonder,
like, is the Cecil Hotel consumed by a nexus of dark energy?
translation.ko: 어둠의 힘에 사로잡힌 게 아닌가 궁금해하죠

translation.en: We've got missing persons…
suicides…
overdoses.
[man 2] For some reason, that hotel…
had some extra bit of insanity going on within those walls.
translation.ko: 그 호텔 안에선 광기의 도가 좀 지나친 것 같아요

translation.en: Drug dealers.
Prostitutes.
-Rapists. -[screams] Murderers.
The Cecil is a place where serial killers, you know, let their hair down.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔은 연쇄 살인범들이 쉬러 오는 곳이에요

translation.en: Hail, Satan!
And if you didn't watch yourself, you might come flying out the window.
[man 4] Bad things keep happening there, over and over and over and over again.
translation.ko: 거기선 나쁜 일이 반복해서 계속 일어나요

translation.en: Why?
I would have never thought what was about to happen could happen.
translation.ko: 지금 일어나려는 일이 실제 일어날 거라곤 상상도 못 했어요

translation.en: [man 5] With Elisa Lam,
you're talking about a 21-year-old college student that just completely disappears.
The hotel is where we have to start.
But then the investigation took on a life of its own.
translation.ko: 그런데 수사가 점점 걷잡을 수 없게 됐어요

translation.en: [man 6] I have spent hours and hours investigating this.
In the elevator, she's acting very strange.
[woman] What's with the hand movements?
There's more to the story than meets the eye.
I think that somebody from the LAPD was corrupt.
translation.ko: LA 경찰에 부패한 경찰이 있는 거 같아요

translation.en: I believe somebody in the Cecil Hotel was involved.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔의 누군가가 연루된 것 같아요

translation.en: You don't have to be a conspiracy theorist to say, "What the fuck?"
translation.ko: 꼭 음모론자가 아니더라도 이런 생각이 들죠 '도대체 뭐지?'

translation.en: I think that Elisa Lam was almost like an insect caught in a trap.
translation.ko: 엘리사 램은 덫에 걸린 벌레나 다름없었어요

translation.en: The Cecil was able to lure her to come inside.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔이 엘리사를 안으로 들어오라고 유인했죠

translation.en: [man 4] The Cecil Hotel is this exalted space of crime…
of violence…
of spookiness…
-[elevator dings] -…that just continues to call to us.
-[uneasy music playing] -[siren wailing]
[woman] Bless the internet.
The internet doesn't really have consequences.
At least on Tumblr, I hope.
People can really be themselves.
It makes more sense to write candidly here than a journal,
translation.ko: 일기보다 여기에 진솔하게 쓰는 게 더 낫다

translation.en: because you knowsomeone's actually listening to your random thoughts.
translation.ko: 누군가는 내 정리 안 된 생각을 읽을 테니 말이다

translation.en: Also, my handwriting is terrible and I type faster than I write.
translation.ko: 그리고 난 글씨를 못 쓰고 자판이 더 빠르다

translation.en: Also, this is way cheaper than paying for a therapist.
translation.ko: 그리고 심리 상담보다 이게 훨씬 싸게 먹힌다

translation.en: Also, I get intense satisfaction when I click publish.
Stressed about university.
Somehow we're supposed to jump to some kind of maturity
right after leaving high school.
You enter a crash course into the shit hole
that is figuring out what the hell you want out of life.
translation.ko: 인생에서 뭘 할지 알아내는 곳이 대학이다

translation.en: Damn it, people. We're trying to figure things out.
I want to get away.
Travel.
Must travel this summer for sanity.
translation.ko: 미치지 않으려면 올여름에 꼭 여행을 떠나야 한다

translation.en: Must find job to get monies for traveling.
translation.ko: 여행 경비를 벌기 위해 직장을 구해야 한다 "캐나다 여권"

translation.en: Must convince parents to allow me to travel on my own.
translation.ko: 나 혼자 여행하게 해달라고 부모님을 설득해야 한다

translation.en: I'm freaking 21 now.
Going to be okay.
Planning, planning, planning.
San Diego, Los Angeles, Santa Cruz, and San Francisco.
The West Coast tour.
Suggestions and recommendations highly, highly appreciated and needed.
translation.ko: 좋은 곳을 추천해 주면 정말 정말 고맙겠어, 진짜 간절해

translation.en: Have arrived in La-La Land.
And the rest is to be written.
[newsman] Elisa Lam from Vancouver, Canada is missing.
translation.ko: 캐나다 밴쿠버 출신의 엘리사 램이 실종됐습니다

translation.en: She was traveling by herself,
spent a few days in San Diego,
and then came to Los Angeles on the 28th of January.
[newswoman] The young woman planned to see more of California, say police.
translation.ko: 경찰은 이 여성이 캘리포니아를 계속 여행할 계획이었다고 합니다

translation.en: [newsman 2] January 31st was the last time her family in Canada had heard from her.
[newswoman 2] It is possible that Ms. Lam is either hurt or in danger.
translation.ko: 램 씨는 다쳤거나 위험에 처했을 수도 있습니다

translation.en: She has no history of any kind of behavior
that would end up like this.
[newsman] LAPD's elite robbery-homicide section is on the case.
translation.ko: LA 경찰의 강도 살인 부서가 이 일을 수사 중입니다

translation.en: [Marcia] My name's Tim Marcia.
I was a detective with the Los Angeles Police Department.
One morning,
we were told that we had picked up a missing persons case.
She was a young female from Canada,
traveling throughout California by herself. There was a sense of panic.
translation.ko: 젊은 캐나다 여성이라고요 다들 바짝 긴장했죠

translation.en: There was probably about 18 detectives, uh, from robbery-homicide division, uh, that responded.
translation.ko: 강도 살인 부서 소속 형사 18명 정도가 투입됐어요

translation.en: [man] Elisa Lam's family told the police department
translation.ko: 엘리사 램의 가족은 엘리사가 매일 집에 전화했다고 경찰에 말했어요

translation.en: that she would typically call every day.
translation.ko: 엘리사 램의 가족은 엘리사가 매일 집에 전화했다고 경찰에 말했어요 "그레그 케이딩 전직 LA 경찰 강력반 형사"

translation.en: It was just routine for her to check in,
and she hadn't called, and that concerned them.
So there was a true sense of urgency.
We sat there and we discussed, "What are the possibilities?"
One, that she doesn't want to be found.
translation.ko: 첫째는 본인이 발견되길 원치 않는 거예요

translation.en: She's off the radar by choice.
Maybe she was disoriented, not being familiar with Los Angeles,
and she's lost.
Or could it be something worse than that…
where she was a victim of some type of accident
translation.ko: 예기치 않은 사고를 당했거나 범죄의 희생자가 된 것은 아닐까요?

translation.en: or some type of crime?
The investigators begin to exchange information with Elisa Lam's family
translation.ko: 수사관들은 엘리사 램의 가족과 정보를 교환하며

translation.en: to figure out where she was last seen, last known to have been,
and they had learned that it was the hotel where she was staying.
[newswoman] A hotel with a notorious past is the site of another bizarre case.
translation.ko: 악명 높은 과거가 있는 호텔에서 또 기이한 사건이 일어났습니다

translation.en: [newsman] Elisa was staying here at the Cecil Hotel in downtown Los Angeles.
translation.ko: 엘리사는 로스앤젤레스 시내의 세실 호텔에서 묵고 있었습니다

translation.en: It has $85-a-night rooms and mostly guests from foreign countries.
Nearly 20 robbery-homicide detectives at mid-afternoon swarmed the hotel,
translation.ko: 20명 가까운 강도 살인 부서 형사들이 오후에 목격자와 단서를 찾으려고 호텔로 들이닥쳤습니다

translation.en: presumably looking for witnesses and clues.
I was the general manager of the Cecil Hotel from 2007 to 2017,
translation.ko: 제가 2007년부터 2017년까지 세실 호텔 지배인이었으니 "에이미 프라이스 전직 세실 호텔 매니저"

translation.en: so ten years.
It was like my kingdom. [chuckles]
It was a kingdom, you know.
I've also called it a zoo. [chuckles]
You just never knew what was gonna happen…
at any given day.
At the time when Elisa Lam went missing, it was alarming,
but we cooperated with the police officers,
trying to help the best we can every step of the way.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 한 수사에 도움을 주려고 했어요

translation.en: I told detectives that she checked into our hotel on January 28th, 2013.
As far as I know, she was gonna be staying with us for four days.
translation.ko: 엘리사는 원래 나흘 동안 묵을 생각이었던 거 같아요

translation.en: 506 was a female bunk room.
Community toilets and showers were down the hall.
translation.ko: 공동 화장실과 샤워실이 복도 끝에 있었어요

translation.en: Young travelers are on a budget. They just want a clean place to stay.
translation.ko: 예산이 빠듯한 젊은 여행자들은 깨끗한 잠자리면 됐거든요

translation.en: Elisa was supposed to check out on February 1st,
which was also the day that she was reported missing.
[Kading] The investigators went to her room…
to search for potential evidence.
But they learned that the hotel staff removed all her personal belongings.
translation.ko: 호텔 직원이 개인 소지품을 다 치워버렸더군요

translation.en: [Price] In a hotel, when somebody doesn't physically check out
and they leave property in the room,
it's just protocol that you… you know, you bag up the belongings
and you store you 'em for 30 days.
You'd be surprised what people leave at the hotel.
translation.ko: 상상도 못 할 물건을 두고 가기도 해요

translation.en: We found a snake once in the hotel, in the… the bathtub.
translation.ko: 욕조에 뱀을 두고 간 투숙객도 있었어요

translation.en: Investigators discovered that her laptop had been left behind…
her prescription medications, other items of value.
[Price] Her wallet, all of the clothes that she wore,
all those things were… were left behind in the room.
[Marcia] The employee that had bagged up her belongings
said that the room was in disarray, as in messy,
but not as in foul play.
There was no evidence of forced entry into the room.
There was no paraphernalia or drugs,
but I remember feeling instinctively
translation.ko: 왠지 끝이 안 좋을 거 같다고

translation.en: that this does not feel like it's gonna end well.
-[tea kettle whistling] -[guitar tuning]
[woman] My husband Mike and I, we always wanted to go and visit America,
translation.ko: 남편인 마이크와 저는 항상 미국, 그중에서도 특히

translation.en: especially Los Angeles.
A bit of sunshine,
translation.ko: 비가 많이 내리는 우중충한 영국을 떠나

translation.en: travel away from rainy, miserable England. [laughs]
translation.ko: 비가 많이 내리는 우중충한 영국을 떠나 태양을 즐기고 싶었죠

translation.en: [laughs] Yeah, actually.
[Sabina Baugh] One day, Mike said, "Why don't we go to L.A.?"
translation.ko: 어느 날 마이크가 그랬죠 '우리 LA에 갈까?'

translation.en: And I said, "Yeah, sure, let's go."
[Mike Baugh] We found this particular holiday for two weeks,
and it was fairly cheap.
There was no information on the hotel.
It just said "downtown L.A.," but it was a really good deal.
translation.ko: 'LA 시내'라고만 돼 있었는데 정말 가격이 저렴했어요

translation.en: So we thought, "Why don't we do it?"
It was our first trip to America, and we were very excited for it.
translation.ko: 미국 여행은 처음인지라 둘 다 정말 신나 있었어요

translation.en: [Mike Baugh] So we're driving through downtown L.A.,
going straight to the hotel.
So the taxi driver dropped us off at the hotel.
The outside looked really nice.
[Sabina Baugh] And we saw the sign that said "the Cecil Hotel."
We walked into the lobby
and we were like, "Wow."
It looked really beautiful, grand.
[Mike Baugh] Very big and very spacious,
with big pillars.
[Sabina Baugh] We got our key, so we went upstairs.
The minute you leave the lobby and go into the elevator…
…you've gone back to, like, 1986.
And so, when we got to the… our room…
The room was dirty. There was dust everywhere.
And the carpet was…
almost sticky.
You almost had to peel your feet as you were walking. Not quite, but almost.
translation.ko: 걸을 때마다 발을 억지로 떼어놔야 할 정도였죠

translation.en: But because of the price we paid for it,
translation.ko: 하지만 워낙 싸게 왔으니 이렇게 생각했어요

translation.en: we thought, "Oh, that's okay. We will only wash and sleep here anyway."
[Mike Baugh] We thought, "Be positive. It's okay.
What… What can go wrong?" You know.
So we just dropped the stuff off, went outside to find somewhere to eat.
translation.ko: 그래서 짐을 풀고 뭘 좀 먹으러 나갔어요

translation.en: [Sabina Baugh] Because we were so jet-lagged and so tired, we got lost,
translation.ko: 둘 다 시차 때문에 너무 피곤해 길을 잃어서

translation.en: and we started asking people, "Oh, where's Cecil Hotel?"
And people were giving us looks.
[Mike Baugh] And the next thing we saw was a lamppost
that had a missing person's picture on it.
[Sabina Baugh] This one guy mentioned, "That girl, she's gone missing.
translation.ko: 한 남자가 그러더군요 '저 여자 실종돼서 지금 경찰이 찾고 있어요'

translation.en: They're looking for her."
translation.ko: '저 여자 실종돼서 지금 경찰이 찾고 있어요'

translation.en: She stayed in Cecil Hotel, where we were staying.
translation.ko: 그 여자도 우리가 묵고 있는 세실 호텔에 묵었더라고요

translation.en: And then we thought, "Are we safe and secure in the hotel?"
[Kading] After the discovery of Elisa's personal belongings,
investigators had no leads as to where she might have been.
translation.ko: 수사관들은 엘리사의 행방에 관한 단서를 못 찾았습니다

translation.en: So we needed first-hand accounts from witnesses at the hotel.
translation.ko: 그래서 호텔 내 목격자들의 진술이 필요했는데

translation.en: And it's imperative that we speak to as many people as possible.
translation.ko: 그러려면 최대한 많은 사람을 만나야 했어요

translation.en: Who did she have contact with in the hotel itself?
What employees did she have contact with?
I gave them all the information of who was staying at the hotel,
the names of everyone that has worked at our hotel.
At that time, we had about 50 employees.
[man in Spanish] I was a maintenance worker at the hotel.
I spent time with the police,
who were interviewing me and talking to me.
translation.ko: 그 일에 관해 이런저런 질문을 하더군요

translation.en: I told them that I never saw her.
translation.ko: 전 그 여자 못 봤다고 했어요

translation.en: But the receptionist, the guy at the front desk,
they say that she looked like she was a student.
She was always with a book.
[Marcia in English] We spoke to the employees
that worked the late shift on the night of her disappearance,
translation.ko: 엘리사가 실종되던 날 밤 근무한 야간 당직 직원들에게 물어보니

translation.en: and they said that they had seen Elisa in an area that no guests were allowed in,
translation.ko: 엘리사가 손님 출입 금지 구역에 있는 걸 보고

translation.en: so they actually asked her to leave,
and she walked towards the bank of the elevators.
But that was the last time that anybody saw her.
Unfortunately, investigators were unable to come up with anything
that, uh, might have helped locate Elisa.
[man] I don't typically do a lot of missing persons stories.
translation.ko: 실종 사건은 제 전문 분야가 아니에요

translation.en: But there was something really mysterious about this story,
translation.ko: 하지만 이 이야기에는 수수께끼 같은 면이 있고

translation.en: um, and I felt like the Elisa Lam case
translation.ko: "조시 딘 기자" 이 엘리사 램 사건의 경우

translation.en: was a puzzle that maybe I could put together.
translation.ko: 제가 맞출 수 있는 퍼즐 같다고 생각했어요

translation.en: According to the police, not a lot is known about her,
translation.ko: 경찰에 따르면 엘리사는 홍콩 이민자 가족의

translation.en: except that she's one of two daughters of an immigrant family from Hong Kong.
translation.ko: 두 딸 중 하나란 것 외엔 알려진 게 별로 없어요

translation.en: So she's first generation.
Her parents own a… a Chinese restaurant,
and she's attending classes at the University of British Columbia.
And she was, like a lot of young people, all over social media.
translation.ko: 그리고 다른 젊은 친구들처럼 SNS를 활발히 했어요

translation.en: Tumblr was her platform of choice
that she seemed to treat almost like a diary.
translation.ko: 거기에 매일 일기 쓰듯이 글을 올렸더라고요

translation.en: Because she was such a prolific poster,
police were able to use her social media to retrace her steps.
translation.ko: 경찰은 SNS로 엘리사의 자취를 따라갈 수 있었죠

translation.en: It was almost like she'd left these digital breadcrumbs to follow.
translation.ko: 따라오라고 디지털 빵가루를 뿌려둔 것 같았어요

translation.en: It was discovered that she had an itinerary, to a certain degree…
translation.ko: 확인해 보니 어느 정도는 상세한 일정표가 있었고

translation.en: and that she had been down in San Diego.
[Dean] Elisa arrived in L.A.
Checks into the hotel.
Has a normal few days of being a tourist.
And during her trip,
we know she went to a taping of a TV show.
We know she was going out,
and she was clearly open to meeting and hanging out with strangers.
translation.ko: 모르는 사람들을 만나는 것에 별로 거리낌이 없었더라고요

translation.en: Did she have any, uh…
friendships or love interests that were developed via the internet,
where she was traveling to meet up with somebody?
translation.ko: 누군가를 만나려고 여행 온 거였을까요? "미팅 신청 수락"

translation.en: And so efforts were put in to try to identify that.
[Kading] Eventually, investigators found a bookstore she had visited
translation.ko: 결국 수사관들은 엘리사가 실종된 날에 갔던

translation.en: on the day she went missing.
[Marcia] We went and talked to the management there,
translation.ko: 그 서점에 찾아가 직원과 얘기를 했는데

translation.en: and they actually remembered Elisa coming into the location.
[woman] She was talking about what books she was getting
and whether what she was getting would be too heavy
translation.ko: 여행할 때 가지고 다니거나 집으로 가져가기에

translation.en: to carry around as she traveled or take home with her.
She was very outgoing, very lively, very friendly.
So she went to a bookstore, came back to the hotel, then vanished.
translation.ko: 서점에 갔다 호텔로 돌아온 후에 사라졌어요

translation.en: Only there's no trace of her.
[Marcia] At this point, she had been missing for approximately five days,
translation.ko: 저 때가 실종된 지 5일쯤 됐을 땐데

translation.en: and we don't have anything.
My instinctive feeling was
the Cecil Hotel had something to do with her disappearance.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔이 엘리사의 실종에 관련이 있는 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Dean] There is no Elisa Lam story without the context of the Cecil Hotel.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔 없이는 엘리사 램 이야기도 없어요

translation.en: The fact that it happened at the Cecil, that Elisa Lam disappeared at the Cecil,
translation.ko: 엘리사 램이 사라진 곳이 세실 호텔이라는 사실 때문에

translation.en: makes it sort of a historic mystery,
translation.ko: 이 사건이 역사적인 수수께끼가 된 거고

translation.en: and the Cecil is as much a character as Elisa is.
The story of the Cecil, it's a story of adventure.
It's a story of things you just can't predict.
In the beginning, it was nice. I wish I could see what it was like.
translation.ko: 처음 지었을 땐 멋졌어요 그때 봤으면 좋았을걸

translation.en: Must have been so exciting.
1919, Los Angeles is the biggest boomtown anyone's ever seen.
Everyone was pouring into Los Angeles.
[man] This mecca is booming with business and enterprise
translation.ko: 이 메카에서는 갖가지 사업이 번창 일로에 있으며

translation.en: and its legends of greatness and glamour.
[Schave] The downtown area was at the center of the explosion.
translation.ko: 도심 지역은 폭발적 성장의 중심에 있었어요

translation.en: The Hotel Cecil opens at the end of 1924.
Costs a million dollars, which is a lot of money back then.
translation.ko: 당시로는 꽤 큰 액수인 백만 달러가 들어갔어요

translation.en: [man] Awe-inspiring and breathtaking is the Cecil Hotel.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔은 숨이 멎을 만큼 위풍당당하게

translation.en: Rising above the rooftops of Hollywood,
translation.ko: 할리우드 건물 위로 우뚝 서 있으며

translation.en: it is one of the most beautifully constructed hotels of its type
translation.ko: 이런 형태의 건축으로 이렇게 아름다운 호텔은

translation.en: to be found anywhere.
She has good bones. She was done right.
[Schave] For Los Angeles, the Cecil is so… so big.
It has 700 rooms.
[woman] It's not a luxury hotel.
Some people are willing to pay a little less for a little less comfort.
translation.ko: 돈을 좀 덜 낸다면 불편을 감수하는 사람들도 있어요

translation.en: It's really a travelers' hotel.
[Schave] It's down the block from the Pacific Electric light rail station.
translation.ko: 퍼시픽일렉트릭 경전철 역이 있는 블록에 있는데

translation.en: 100,000 people a day, coming in and out of that railway station.
And the Hotel Cecil was happy to accommodate them.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔은 그 사람들을 기꺼이 수용했고요

translation.en: It's exactly what everyone wanted to see in the middle 1920s,
translation.ko: 1920년대 중반엔 모두가 보고 싶어 했던 건데

translation.en: and then it all burst.
[man] Industrial America was truly the land of plenty.
Then with appalling suddenness came the beginning
of the greatest depression of all time.
Stocks collapsed, factories shut down, businesses passed out of existence.
translation.ko: 주식 시장이 붕괴되고, 공장이 문을 닫고, 사업체가 망했습니다

translation.en: Unemployment swept the nation like a horrible pestilence.
translation.ko: 실직이 끔찍한 역병처럼 전국을 휩쓸었습니다 "실직자 증가"

translation.en: [Schave] It was very hard on all of downtown.
By the early 1930s, the Hotel Cecil was very much down on its heels.
translation.ko: 1930년대 초반이 되자 세실 호텔은 완전히 쇠퇴했어요

translation.en: And so it becomes
a hotel of older gentleman
who really want to spend as little money as possible
to stay there as long as possible.
[Price] There were so many different phases the hotel went through.
translation.ko: 호텔은 그동안 정말 여러 단계를 거쳤어요

translation.en: I was staying in the Cecil, I would say, back in, like, say, '81, '82, '83.
Even back, you know what I'm saying, like '90s.
When I had money, the Cecil, that was like… that was like the spot.
translation.ko: 돈이 생기면 딱 가기 좋은 곳이 세실이었어요

translation.en: You know, that's where I used to go for, like, two, three dollars a night.
You know, you had your color TV and all that,
the carpet on the floor.
You had the big liquor market right there on the corner.
I would take me a little companion up there, a little female friend,
and we would stay up there.
And hey, we would get it on.
You know, that's… [laughs] You know it.
Believe me, there was a lot going on in the Cecil.
Drugs, robberies, prostitutes.
I mean, I was out there doing my dirt too. You know, I wasn't no angel out there.
translation.ko: 나도 나쁜 짓깨나 했죠 나도 천사는 아니었어요

translation.en: Back in the day, that used to be a very scandalous hotel.
translation.ko: 그 당시에 세실 호텔은 추문이 많은 곳이었어요

translation.en: The way I see it is, it's like the Titanic.
When the Titanic sailed off, it was a beautiful ship.
Everybody's thinking,
"My God, this is just state-of-the-art, this gorgeous ship, unsinkable." You know?
translation.ko: '어머나, 이건 최첨단이고 아름답고 안 가라앉는 배야'

translation.en: Well, we all know what happened to the Titanic.
[Marcia] Right now…
we have a 21-year-old who's lost somewhere in the city.
We knew that she was in danger.
translation.ko: 그 여성이 위험에 처했단 걸 알았어요

translation.en: Me, personally, as a parent of a daughter who was 19 at that time, I think…
you have a flash that there's some type of connection to your own family.
translation.ko: 내 가족의 일인 것 같은 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: Let's just pray we find her.
Everybody ready?
[Kading] The LAPD were very concerned,
so they had a press conference with the family
in an effort to try to get help from the public.
Okay, I'm gonna introduce Lieutenant Walter Teague, T-e-a-g-u-e.
He's, uh, the officer in charge up at robbery-homicide division.
translation.ko: 강도 살인 부서를 책임지는 경찰관입니다 "엘리사 실종 6일째"

translation.en: His team is handling this, uh, missing case.
translation.ko: "엘리사 실종 6일째" 이분 팀이 그 사건을 맡고 있어요

translation.en: Uh, also with us…
Uh, they will not be speaking, but this is the family of Elisa Lam.
translation.ko: 오늘 인터뷰는 안 하시지만 엘리사 램의 가족이 오셨어요

translation.en: And, uh, I'll let, uh, Lieutenant Teague take over from here.
Good afternoon. Uh, thanks for coming.
So it's been five days, six days now.
There's been no communication at all,
and, uh, that's, uh, worried us and worried the family.
translation.ko: 그래서 경찰도, 가족도 무척 염려가 됩니다

translation.en: Seeking to get this photo out so we can, uh, find Elisa.
translation.ko: 엘리사를 찾기 위해 이 사진을 공개합니다

translation.en: [reporter] Is there surveillance video showing her coming and going from the hotel?
translation.ko: 실종자가 호텔에 드나드는 걸 찍은 감시 카메라 영상이 있나요?

translation.en: We're in the process of investigating that
and, uh, collecting anything we can in that angle.
translation.ko: 그 각도에서 모든 증거를 모으고 있어요

translation.en: We're continuing the investigation now, and we're looking for your help.
[reporter] Would the parents like to say anything?
[LAPD speaker] Not at this time.
[newsman] If a mother's face can tell the story, here it is.
translation.ko: 어머니의 표정을 보면 알 수 있듯이

translation.en: Worry.
And from a father, somber concern.
Her parents and sister flew in from Canada to help.
translation.ko: 사건을 돕기 위해 캐나다에서 부모님과 여동생이 왔습니다

translation.en: They are baffled.
[Elisa Lam] Dearest Tumblr lurker, reader, stalker,
whoever is interested in the trials and tribulations of my fascinating life…
translation.ko: 내 멋진 인생의 시련과 고난에 관심이 있는 사람에게 말하는데

translation.en: There is a wider world out there, and I have only seen a fraction of it.
translation.ko: 세상은 정말 넓디넓고 난 그 일부밖에 못 봤어

translation.en: I'm very excited. I'll be seeing new places
translation.ko: 난 정말 신나 새로운 곳을 볼 거고

translation.en: and hopefully meet some interesting and nice people.
translation.ko: 흥미롭고 친절한 사람들도 만나길 기대하고 있어

translation.en: I'd be fine with a stranger talking to me,
translation.ko: 낯선 사람이 내게 말을 거는 건 괜찮은데

translation.en: but I'm not very conscious of what I'm saying most of the time.
translation.ko: 난 보통 별로 생각을 안 하고 말을 하는 편이야

translation.en: I take things too far and I have no filter.
It seems I always make the biggest mistakes
at the worst possible moments.
translation.ko: 가장 큰 실수를 저지르는 것 같아

translation.en: My mouth is my downfall,
and it will get me in trouble.
[Sabina Baugh] From our sunny holiday in California…
we just wanted to explore a little bit.
This weather, it's so warm and lovely.
We love walking, and we just wanted to see as much as possible.
translation.ko: 둘 다 걷는 걸 좋아하고 최대한 많이 보고 싶었어요

translation.en: [Mike Baugh] So we left really early.
Got out, spent the day out.
We thought, "Ooh, it's downtown L.A., we're right in the middle of it.
translation.ko: 여기가 LA 시내니까 번화가일 거로 생각하니

translation.en: How awesome!"
[Mike Baugh] But when you look at the environment of downtown,
it's the exact opposite of my expectation.
[Sabina Baugh] We were walking and we saw a lot of homeless people.
Rows and rows, and they're all outside on the street, sleeping.
translation.ko: 거리에 끝도 없이 늘어서 있고 잠도 자더군요

translation.en: And you can see they live… they live outside.
And then we found out that this area around the hotel is called Skid Row.
translation.ko: 그리고 호텔 주변 지역이 스키드로라는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: Skid Row has a reputation to be a dangerous place.
That was a big shock.
[man] A visitor staying at the Cecil,
you just think, "Well, I'm downtown. Let me take a walk and see what's here."
translation.ko: 세실 호텔 투숙객들은 이렇게 생각하죠 '여기가 시내니까 좀 걸으면서 뭐가 있는지 봐야지'

translation.en: And little do you know that you're staying at Ground Zero
translation.ko: "짐 맥솔리, 수사 담당 경사 로스앤젤레스" 본인이 미합중국에서도 가장 위험하고

translation.en: of one of the most dangerous and violent places
translation.ko: 본인이 미합중국에서도 가장 위험하고 가장 폭력적인 곳 중 하나의 본거지에 있단 걸

translation.en: in the United States of America.
[man 2] Skid Row is a 56-block area in downtown Los Angeles.
It's one of the poorest areas in the entire world,
translation.ko: 전 세계에서 가장 가난한 지역 중 하나로

translation.en: and it's existed for over 100 years.
Currently, about 8,000 to 10,000 homeless individuals
translation.ko: 현재 8천에서 만 명 정도 되는 노숙자가

translation.en: live on Skid Row.
Let me just say, nobody was born on Skid row.
There's a lot of stories there.
I'm from New York City.
When I lost my job,
I just took to the road, and eventually I wound up here in L.A.
translation.ko: 무작정 길을 떠났다 이곳 LA에 정착하게 됐죠

translation.en: And, you know, I found myself living on the streets of Skid Row for 21 years.
You know, it's pretty rough.
They got all the missions, shelters, right here.
translation.ko: 각종 선교 단체와 구호소가 다 들어와 있어요

translation.en: [Mungin] Almost all of our homeless services are located in this one area.
translation.ko: 노숙자 지원 센터는 전부 이 한 지역에 밀집돼 있어요

translation.en: So the only place to really go if you're homeless and want assistance
translation.ko: 그러니 노숙자가 도움을 얻을 수 있는 유일한 곳이

translation.en: is Skid Row.
And it's become a dumping ground.
After people are released from prison or jail or from a mental facility,
they are dropped off on Skid Row,
because the city wanted to make sure that these types of people
translation.ko: 당국에서는 이런 사람들을 로스앤젤레스의 다른 지역과 분리하고 싶었거든요

translation.en: remain separated from the rest of Los Angeles.
[Schave] In the early 1970s,
the city came out with this plan.
The policy of containment.
[man] Get out of the street!
[McSorley] Containment was like an experiment of,
"Let's see if we can contain anything bad going on in the rest of the city…"
Let's go, move back. All the way back.
"…and direct it to Skid Row."
It was like they just put an artificial moat around this place.
translation.ko: 주변에 인공 해자를 만든 거 같아요

translation.en: And now the police are literally therewith a barrier
stopping the homeless population from being allowed to leave.
But within this border of Skid Row, it's the Wild West.
translation.ko: 하지만 스키드로의 경계선 안은 서부시대 같아요

translation.en: [McSorley] Within the boundaries, it was kind of like, um, a free-for-all,
where people were allowed to sleep on the streets,
buy drugs,
sell their bodies.
[Mungin] You have a huge drug population on Skid Row.
translation.ko: 스키드로엔 마약 하는 사람들이 엄청나게 많아요

translation.en: You have a huge population of mental illness.
This is a space where people are allowed to just suffer.
And this manifests itself on the street
as crime and violence.
[McSorley] I'm a detective sergeant.
I did a couple different tours in Skid Row,
addressing just street crime.
-[siren wailing] -So that could be breaking up a bar brawl…
or arresting someone that's buck naked running down the street with a machete.
translation.ko: 발가벗은 채 도끼를 들고 거리를 달리는 사람을 체포했죠

translation.en: Burned in my memory is a guy holding a live pigeon.
translation.ko: 각인된 기억이 하나 있는데 한 남자가 산 비둘기를

translation.en: And I'm looking at him while he put it in his mouth,
you know, rips its head off,
blood squirting all over.
People have been killed just walking down the street
and someone is raging.
[Kading] Anybody's vulnerable…
especially if you're a naive girl from some other country
translation.ko: 특히 다른 나라에서 온 순진한 소녀라면요

translation.en: who's here thinking that it's all peaches and roses.
translation.ko: 모든 게 장밋빛일 거라고 생각할 텐데

translation.en: It's… Uh, it's misleading.
If Elisa is out at night by herself, she could easily become a victim.
translation.ko: 엘리사가 밤중에 혼자 다녔으면 쉽게 희생자가 됐을 거예요

translation.en: Is it possible she was abducted and she's being held against her will?
translation.ko: 유괴를 당했거나 억지로 끌려갔을 가능성도 있죠

translation.en: So we were looking into who in the area could be a person of interest.
Someone she had met during her travels,
or somebody that she met at the hotel.
[Kading] Over at the hotel…
the investigators became aware that there was security footage.
translation.ko: 호텔에 보안 카메라 영상이 있단 걸 알았어요

translation.en: [Price] The hotel has cameras in the lobby and the elevators,
translation.ko: 호텔에 카메라가 설치된 곳은 로비, 엘리베이터

translation.en: the front of the hotel,
you know, most of the common areas.
[Marcia] When we started to look at their… [sighs] their video systems,
we find out that not all floors have video cameras,
translation.ko: 호텔의 모든 층에 카메라가 있는 건 아니었으며

translation.en: and that there is no camera on Elisa's floor.
And the positions of these cameras weren't always in the greatest position,
translation.ko: 그리고 카메라가 있어도 위치가 별로 안 좋고

translation.en: or the quality of the video itself was not that great.
So now it's kind of a needle in a haystack of how we can identify her.
translation.ko: 엘리사를 찾는 건 건초더미에서 바늘 찾기였어요

translation.en: [Kading] There was a lot of video footage to review.
translation.ko: 봐야 할 비디오 영상이 너무 많았어요

translation.en: Days' worth. Hundreds of hours.
[Marcia] We decided, "We have to watch this minute for minute."
translation.ko: 우린 한순간도 놓치면 안 된다고 생각했어요

translation.en: My partner and I were assigned that task.
translation.ko: 제 동료와 제가 그 일을 맡았어요

translation.en: Management gave us a little office
and we sat there, uh, for 20 hours a day,
watching video.
We focused on the night of Elisa's disappearance.
translation.ko: 엘리사가 실종된 날 밤을 집중적으로 봤죠

translation.en: The last thing you want to do is miss something.
It was just a laborious, laborious task.
Continually watching to see who's coming, who's going, where's Elisa?
translation.ko: 누가 오고 가는지 지켜보며 엘리사를 찾았어요

translation.en: And all of a sudden…
we see her on camera.
And we both just jumped,
both wanting to hit pause on the, uh, DVR.
And he beat me because he's younger.
It was a moment of excitement because it's something to work with.
translation.ko: 정말 흥분되는 순간이었어요 뭔가 단서를 찾았으니까요

translation.en: It's a piece.
But I remember… talking to my partner, saying…
translation.ko: 하지만 동료에게 이런 말을 한 기억이 나요

translation.en: "Her behavior is unusual."
So we sat there and we… we watched the video several times,
translation.ko: 그래서 앉아서 영상을 몇 번 반복해서 보면서

translation.en: and then plotted out where she could have gone
translation.ko: 엘리사가 갔을 만한 곳을 추리해 봤어요

translation.en: to try to figure out if she left, when she left,
translation.ko: 호텔을 떠났는지 떠났다면 몇 시에 떠났는지

translation.en: and if she left with somebody.
In reviewing all the footage
and watching the… the exiting and entrance…
we never saw her leave.
And we communicated that to our peers,
that we felt that she's still here, somewhere.
She never left the hotel. She never left the hotel.
So…
if she never left,
then where could she be?
Or who within the hotel could be a potential suspect?
translation.ko: 호텔 내에서 누가 용의자가 될 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Who could have either hurt Elisa,
or has her under their control?
[Cooper] I think that Elisa Lam walked into a situation that was very different from what she expected.
translation.ko: 엘리사 램은 기대했던 것과는 다른 상황에 직면했던 거 같아요

translation.en: You really don't know who is sharing this environment.
translation.ko: 이런 환경에 어떤 사람이 살지는 아무도 모르니까요

translation.en: [Price] So many different types of people check into the Cecil on a regular basis.
translation.ko: 세실 호텔에는 항상 다양한 사람들이 들어와요

translation.en: I mean, it was somewhat of a flop house.
For some of our guests, there's some despair going on.
[Cooper] Tourists probably don't realize,
but the Cecil Hotel is an alternative to apartment living
for people who don't have a deposit, can't pass a background check.
translation.ko: 신원조회를 통과 못 하는 사람들의 아파트 같은 곳이었어요

translation.en: They don't want someone knowing where they are.
And so it attracts people who are fresh out of prison…
people who are on the run.
The person who's in the elevator with you might be an 85-year-old sex offender
translation.ko: 엘리베이터를 같이 탄 사람이 다른 곳에선 살 수 없는 85세 성범죄자일 수도 있죠

translation.en: who can't live anywhere else.
translation.ko: 다른 곳에선 살 수 없는 85세 성범죄자일 수도 있죠

translation.en: [Price] Sometimes it was scary.
We were faced with a lot of security and safety issues.
In the ten years that I worked there, there were thousands of 911 calls.
translation.ko: 제가 거기서 일한 10년 동안 911에 신고한 것만 수천 건이에요

translation.en: Thousands.
Because, you know, you need help.
[McSorley] When I was on patrol out here, you could expect at least
translation.ko: 이곳을 순찰하는 동안 세실에서 하루 최소 한 통에서 세 통 신고가 들어왔죠

translation.en: -one to three calls a day at the Cecil. -[siren wailing]
translation.ko: 세실에서 하루 최소 한 통에서 세 통 신고가 들어왔죠

translation.en: [McSorley] I remember somebody trying to, um, burn down the hallways.
We would, uh, get domestic violence type of calls…
…or someone just shot up drugs and having a bad trip.
Fights would erupt. You know, assaults, stabbings.
translation.ko: 싸움도 잦았어요 폭행과 칼부림 같은 거요

translation.en: -One of the hottest days… -[flies buzzing]
…it was in August.
And the body we found kind of looked, um, like Grimace from McDonald's.
Completely purple. Wouldn't know what race he was.
translation.ko: 온통 보라색이라 인종을 구분할 수가 없었어요

translation.en: And his body like about to explode, it was so distended.
It was hell on earth, basically.
There was a circumstance where I was giving a tour
and there was a sniper in the… in the hallway.
translation.ko: 제가 손님들에게 호텔을 안내할 때였는데 복도에 저격수가 있었어요

translation.en: Like, a real police sniper with a freaking… a big gun.
translation.ko: 진짜 경찰 저격수처럼 엄청 큰 총을 들었는데

translation.en: The guy looks at me, "Ma'am, get in your room,
there's a person that's stabbed somebody loose inside the building.
translation.ko: '방금 누구를 칼로 찌른 사람이 이 건물을 활보하고 다녀요'

translation.en: [Cooper] There were a lot of creepy people at the Cecil.
There were women staying there
who reported believing being spied on in the shared bathrooms.
[McSorley] Then you mix in the tourist element.
That's a huge mix of people.
I could see Elisa, uh, being overwhelmed.
I don't know if she was equipped to fully function in a hotel like that.
translation.ko: 그런 호텔에서 지낼 정도로 간이 컸는지 모르겠어요

translation.en: [Kading] Since the detectives knew that there was no video footage
translation.ko: 형사들은 엘리사가 세실 호텔을 떠나는 영상이

translation.en: of Elisa leaving the Cecil…
investigators had to search throughout the entire hotel.
And you've got to try to locate her as quickly as possible
in order to protect her, you know, should she be in harm's way.
translation.ko: 큰일 생기기 전에 찾아서 보호해야 하니까요

translation.en: [Marcia] We felt that she has to be in here, somewhere.
translation.ko: 엘리사가 아직 여기 어딘가에 있는 것 같았어요

translation.en: Approximately 14 of us were asked to do an intense search of the hotel.
translation.ko: 형사 14명 정도가 호텔을 샅샅이 수색하는 임무를 맡았어요

translation.en: It's a very large hotel,
and we were all anticipating a very long night.
translation.ko: 아주 긴 밤이 될 거라 예상했어요

translation.en: We get one shot at this. Let's do it right.
translation.ko: 기회는 한 번뿐이라 제대로 해야 했고요

translation.en: You would have to go from room to room to room and everything in between that.
translation.ko: 방을 하나하나 다 확인하고 다른 곳도 확인했어요

translation.en: I said, "Well, we have over 600 closets here, you know.
I mean, okay. Well, let's look at 'em all."
[Lopez in Spanish] The manager had two of us on one floor,
translation.ko: 지배인이 우리 둘을 데리고 층마다 다니며

translation.en: unlocking doors for the officers.
Closets and toilets and everything.
Until all the doors were opened, all of them,
including the basement, in the lockers that were there as well.
[McSorley in English] Looking, literally, under every crack and crevice
translation.ko: 시체를 숨길만 한 곳이나 넣을만한 곳은

translation.en: of where a body could be hidden, where could someone be stowed.
[Price] They started asking questions. "When does garbage go out?
translation.ko: 이런 질문도 하더군요 '쓰레기는 언제 버려요? 직원들은 몇 시에 출근해요?'

translation.en: Your employees, what time do they start? What doors do they come in and out of?"
translation.ko: '쓰레기는 언제 버려요? 직원들은 몇 시에 출근해요?' '어떤 문으로 들고나요?'

translation.en: And I started thinking to myself, "What?
Oh, my gosh. What, do you think she left in a dumpster?"
translation.ko: '세상에, 누가 그 애를 쓰레기통에 버렸다고 생각하나?'

translation.en: It was decided that we would call out scent-tracking dogs.
They will take an item such as a piece of clothing, a sock,
translation.ko: 옷이나 양말 같은 걸 챙겨 왔죠

translation.en: something that will pick up the person's scent.
[Kading] The dogs are led throughout the hotel.
Eventually…
the dog was able to locate the scent from Elisa's room.
translation.ko: 개 한 마리가 엘리사의 방에서 냄새를 맡았어요

translation.en: You get that little heartbeat like, "Oh, we might be onto something."
translation.ko: 심장이 뛰기 시작했죠 '뭔가 풀릴 수도 있겠어'

translation.en: On the fifth floor…
the dog tracked in a westbound direction
towards a big window that looks out from the hallway onto the street,
translation.ko: 복도에서 거리 쪽으로 나 있는 커다란 창으로 갔는데

translation.en: and outside the window, there is a fire escape.
translation.ko: 그 창문 밖으로 화재 비상구가 있었어요

translation.en: [Kading] However…
that's where the scent was lost.
By that time, everybody was on overtime, probably going into a 14 to 16-hour day.
-[helicopter whirring] -A team of detectives with canines was assigned to search the roof.
translation.ko: 한 팀은 형사들이 개를 이끌고 옥상을 수색했어요

translation.en: So they called in LAPD air support division.
translation.ko: LA 경찰 항공 지원팀에도 도움을 요청했고요

translation.en: And they had them illuminate the top of the hotel…
using their night sun.
And they searched up there for… for Elisa and/or evidence
and didn't find anything.
[Kading] This is the big, unanswered question. Where is she?
Traditionally, the outcome after two weeks is probably it's homicide,
translation.ko: 일반적으로 실종 2주가 지나면 살인일 가능성이 높고

translation.en: and the chances of finding that subject really whittle down.
[Marcia] It had gotten late in the evening.
It was close to 10:00 p.m. at night.
And it was decided that the following day, uh, we would regroup.
translation.ko: 그래서 다음 날에 다시 시작하기로 했어요

translation.en: But the following morning, after the search,
translation.ko: 하지만 그다음 날 아침 수색이 끝난 후

translation.en: the LAPD went on tac alert,
because a different investigation came into play.
[newsman] Tactical teams spread across nine counties in Southern California.
LAPD says they are at war tonight
with a man who is targeting law enforcement officers.
translation.ko: 경찰관을 목표물로 삼은 한 남자와 대치 중이라고 발표했습니다

translation.en: Thirty-three-year-old Christopher Dorner, said to be a cop-killer,
translation.ko: 경찰 살인범을 자처한 서른세 살의 크리스토퍼 도너는

translation.en: has said he will not stop the killing until he's dead.
translation.ko: 경찰 살인범을 자처한 서른세 살의 크리스토퍼 도너는 자신이 죽을 때까지 살인을 멈추지 않겠다고 했습니다

translation.en: Christopher Dorner was aformer Los Angeles police officer.
LAPD was under attack by one of their own.
translation.ko: LA 경찰은 같은 경찰의 공격을 받고 있었죠

translation.en: So, the next morning it was decided
that the two lead investigators with myself and my partner
translation.ko: 수사 지휘자인 저와 제 동료 둘만

translation.en: would stay on the Elisa Lam case,
while everybody else, their primary responsibility was the Dorner investigation,
translation.ko: 다른 사람들은 도너 수사에 집중하라는 지시를 받았어요

translation.en: which was a higher priority.
So we went from about 18 detectives down to four.
And that changed the dynamics of our investigation.
translation.ko: 그 때문에 수사의 역학이 바뀌게 됐죠

translation.en: And since there was no information that was developed out of the canvas,
translation.ko: 호텔을 수색한 후에도 알아낸 정보가 전혀 없었기 때문에

translation.en: now we're back to square one.
[Kading] They really don't have any other answers.
So now you're hoping that the public can assist you.
We need the public's help to put more eyes out on the street.
translation.ko: 거리에서 목격한 걸 말해줄 사람들 제보가 필요해요

translation.en: The last footage that we had of Elisa before her disappearance
translation.ko: 엘리사가 실종되기 전에 마지막으로 찍힌 영상은

translation.en: was the footage we found of her inside the elevator.
So it was decided that we would release the video.
We owe it to the family to find her.
We don't have the resources.
It was a no-brainer. So we put it out.
That's where the case starts to go askew.
[man] The initial version of the video comes out on LAPD's website.
translation.ko: 처음엔 동영상이 LA 경찰 웹사이트에 올라왔어요

translation.en: As a YouTuber,
I was looking into content, and I saw the elevator video.
It's a four-minute video,
but there's so much that's going on in such a short time frame.
translation.ko: 그 짧은 시간에 아주 많은 일이 일어났어요

translation.en: Everyone is just captured by it.
[Dean] The doors open and a woman walks in.
[Lordan] She's swinging one arm up, bends over casually to look at the panel,
translation.ko: 한쪽 팔을 흔들면서 몸을 구부려 번호판을 봐요

translation.en: and she's firing down the whole center row of buttons,
translation.ko: 그리고 버튼 한 줄을 다 누르더니

translation.en: and then moves to the corner of the elevator.
She looks like she is relaxed.
She pokes her head out and whips her head both ways.
[Kading] And then she's retreating back and is tucked away into the corner.
translation.ko: 그런 다음 다시 들어와 구석으로 몸을 숨겨요

translation.en: [Mike Baugh] She kept looking outside the door, around the corner to her right.
[Sabina Baugh] Then she would come out of the elevator…
and she would pop up.
[Lordan] She's making these strange steps in almost this square dance motion,
translation.ko: 그리고 스퀘어 댄스 동작 같은 이상한 스텝을 해요

translation.en: Stepping back and forth in the door.
[Sabina Baugh] She'd go to the left, then you wouldn't see her.
[Dean] Then all you can see is a little bit of her arm.
[Lordan] Why is the elevator not going anywhere?
Is someone pressing a button and keeping the elevator here?
translation.ko: 누가 버튼을 눌러 엘리베이터를 잡아둔 걸까요?

translation.en: [Dean] That's when the weird stuff starts happening.
[Lordan] Elisa starts pressing these buttons.
You have to wonder,
"Why are you hitting all these floors like that?"
[Dean] She was running her fingers through her hair a bit.
[Kading] Her hand movements are very strange and erratic.
[Dean] She's waving her hands. It's like she's conjuring a spirit
or, like, acting something out to someone.
[McSorley] You can see the body movements… twisting and turning.
translation.ko: 몸을 뒤틀면서 꼬는 게 보이실 거예요

translation.en: [Dean] And now she appears to be counting with her fingers.
It's just such bizarre behavior.
[Lordan] She exits to the left of the elevator, and then, all of a sudden, she's gone.
[Dean] You think, "That's the end of it."
But you're just looking at an empty elevator.
translation.ko: 이제 텅 빈 엘리베이터를 보고 있어요

translation.en: What the hell's going on here?
[Lordan] She's literally not in the video past about the 2:30 mark.
And for some reason, that's also been released as part of this.
[Dean] One strange thing is that the whole time Elisa is in there, the door never shuts.
translation.ko: 하나 특이한 점은 엘리사가 탔을 땐 문이 안 닫혔는데

translation.en: And now it shuts very quickly.
[Lordan] It's one of those things that makes you scratch your head and say,
translation.ko: 이런 걸 보면 머리를 긁적이며 이런 생각을 하죠

translation.en: "Hmm, this is kind of weird."
[Dean] The door opens back up.
Still nothing happens.
[Lordan] It's like a mini-ghost story built into four minutes.
And the story is about a girl who gets into an elevator.
translation.ko: 그리고 이 이야기는 엘리베이터에 탄 소녀 얘기예요

translation.en: The elevator isn't working properly.
The girl starts having some type of distress and leaves,
and then, all of a sudden, the elevator goes back to normal operation.
Why?
[Dean] Is there a missing clue here that I'm not seeing?
translation.ko: 내가 못 보는 단서가 여기 숨어있나요?

translation.en: Or is there something supernatural happening here?
translation.ko: 아니면 초자연적인 일이 일어나고 있는 걸까요?

translation.en: [Lordan] It's hard to say there isn't something extremely dark and bizarre
translation.ko: 굉장히 어둡고 기이한 일이 일어나지 않는다고는 말하기 어려워요

translation.en: that's going on there.
[Dean] And then at 3:59, the video ends.
I think most people who are seeing this video know what they're looking at.
translation.ko: 이 영상을 본 사람들 대부분은 자신들이 보는 영상이

translation.en: They're looking at the last known footage of a woman who's disappeared.
translation.ko: 실종된 한 여자의 마지막 모습이란 걸 알죠

translation.en: And with that context in mind,
the police unwittingly, like, turned it into a mystery.
translation.ko: 경찰은 의도하지 않았지만 이걸 수수께끼로 만들었어요

translation.en: People were just dying to solve it.
[Kading] I don't think that the LAPD really recognized,
translation.ko: LA 경찰은 그 영상을 공개한 게

translation.en: when they released that video, what they were gonna get in return.
translation.ko: 어떤 결과로 돌아올지 예측하지 못한 거 같아요

translation.en: Now to a new developmentin the search for a woman missing in California.
translation.ko: 캘리포니아에서 실종된 여성의 수색이 새로운 국면을 맞았습니다

translation.en: The LAPD has released bizarre surveillance footage of 21-year-old Elisa Lam.
translation.ko: LA 경찰은 21살 엘리사 램의 감시 카메라 영상을 공개했는데 그게 좀 이상합니다

translation.en: [man] I saw the elevator footage as soon as it was released.
There was reason to be suspicious as to what happened.
And I was drawn in by the story.
[newsman] The footage is from a security camera at the Cecil Hotel,
translation.ko: 실종되기 직전에 세실 호텔 보안 카메라에

translation.en: just before she went missing.
-[man 1] Police are struggling… -[man 2] Police are getting worried.
-[man 3] …a standstill… -[man 4] What happened to Elisa?
translation.ko: 사건은 오리무중으로… 엘리사 램은 어떻게 된 걸까요?

translation.en: We're hoping anyone with information comes forward.
Now the LAPD is asking for your help and fearing for the worst.
translation.ko: 이제 LA 경찰은 최악을 염려하며 여러분의 제보를 기다립니다

translation.en: [Sobhani] We knew we had to help.
And no matter how deep it went or how difficult it might be, we knew…
translation.ko: 사건이 아무리 까다롭고 시간이 얼마가 걸려도요 살아있는 실종자를 찾아야 했어요

translation.en: we had to find her alive.
[newsman] The door closes, and she's never seen again.
translation.ko: 문이 닫힌 후부터 실종자는 다시 보이지 않습니다
